name: Ramsey Theory
description: Ramsey theory states that complete disorder is impossible. It explores how order emerges in large enough structures.

name: Splines
description: Splines are smooth curves used in computer graphics and interpolation.

name: Prime Numbers
description: Prime numbers are integers greater than 1 that have no divisors other than 1 and themselves.

name: Pigeonhole Principle
description: The principle stating that if n items are placed in m containers, where n > m, at least one container must hold more than one item.

visuals.description: Visual representation of the pigeonhole principle.

name: Monte Carlo Method
description: A computational algorithm that uses random sampling to obtain numerical results and solve problems that might be deterministic in principle.

name: No-Free-Lunch Theorem
description: A theorem stating that no optimization algorithm performs better than others when performance is averaged across all possible problems.

name: Four Color Theorem
description: The theorem stating that any map can be colored using no more than four colors such that no two adjacent regions share the same color.

visuals.description: Illustration of the Four Color Theorem.

name: Bayesian Inference
description: A method of statistical inference that updates the probability for a hypothesis as more evidence or information becomes available.

name: Markov Chains
description: A stochastic process that undergoes transitions from one state to another based on certain probabilistic rules.

name: Euler's Identity
description: The mathematical formula e^(iÏ€) + 1 = 0, which is considered one of the most beautiful equations in mathematics.
